meanings.definition: The condition of being abnormally dark or black in coloration.
meanings.sent1: The melanism of the panther helps it blend into the shadows of the forest.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study melanism in animals to understand how coloration affects survival.
meanings.sent3: The melanism of the black cat made it the perfect ninja for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: Her melanism was like a cloak of invisibility, allowing her to move unseen in the night.
meanings.sent5: The melanism of the moth made it nearly invisible against the dark tree bark.

meanings.definition: The development of dark-colored pigmentation in the skin, fur, or feathers.
meanings.sent1: Melanism in birds can provide camouflage in dense forests.
meanings.sent2: The melanism of the bear's fur helped it absorb more heat in the cold winter.
meanings.sent3: The melanism in the raccoon's fur made it look like a tiny bandit.
meanings.sent4: The melanism of the butterfly's wings was a beautiful contrast to the colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The melanism of the squirrel's tail helped it balance while leaping between branches.
